Name: CODEINE
Description: Codeine is a morphinane alkaloid found in the opium poppy, Papaver somniferum var. album; has analgesic, anti-tussive and anti-diarrhoeal properties. It has a role as an opioid analgesic, an antitussive, an opioid receptor agonist, a prodrug, a xenobiotic, an environmental contaminant and a drug allergen. It is an organic heteropentacyclic compound and a morphinane alkaloid. It is functionally related to a morphine. It is a conjugate base of a codeine(1+).

logP.References: Avdeef A et al; J Pharm Sci 39: 4377-81 (1996)

mechanism_of_action.References: American Society of Health-System Pharmacists 2016; Drug Information 2016. Bethesda, MD. 2016, p. 2869
mechanism_of_action.Value: Codeine causes suppression of the cough reflex by a direct effect on the cough center in the medulla of the brain and appears to exert a drying effect on respiratory tract mucosa and to increase viscosity of bronchial secretions.

sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: Codeine was present at below the detection limit of 3.6 ng/g in sediments collected offshore from a wastewater treatment plant in Milwaukee, WI on Lake Michigan. A sediment sample in the immediate vicinity of another plant outflow contained codeine at 4 ng/g(1).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Kinney CA et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 25(2): 317-26 (2006)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: Codeine was not detected in soil samples from 3 sites (city hall, golf course, reclaimed water facility) in a medium-sized city in the Front Range of Colorado following irrigation with reclaimed water from May through September 2003. Codeine concentrations in the irrigation effluent were 58.7, not detected and 27.9 ng/L on May 14, July 16 and September 16, 2003(1).
